data.title: Expected a bit more
data.text: I suppose I wanted more history on the building in the square and ghost stories that were actually scary. It was more like a friend of a cousin who may have heard a ghost type of thing. My 13 year old was really bored, my 16 year old nephew almost walked off with a friend he ran into at a coffee shop and as for the remaining 3 adults well it wasn't much fun, maybe if it was cheaper like a 'you get what you paid for" kind of thing. Then maybe it wouldn't have been so bad. Shelly should always have a bullhorn or some kind of microphone with her as well so the whole group can hear.

data.title: Fun tour!
data.text: We had fun on this tour of the ghost around the courthouse square in Denton.  Learned quite a bit about the history of Denton and the buildings on the square, with some ghost stories thrown in.  Our tour guide (and tour owner) Shelley was a lot of fun and a good story teller.  We walked 3/4 of the way around the square, then 2 blocks over and back, so not too much walking, but a lot of standing.  Our tour ran a little over 2 hours.  It was a fun way to spend an evening in Denton.

data.title: Entertaining tour for the whole family with a nice dash of history thrown in!!
data.text: This was an interesting tour around the courthouse square in Denton. There were stops in front of different buildings that had a historical signifiance and benches where you could sit if tired. We had kids ages 8 to 14 with us and they were entertained by the stories. Shelly was an engaging tour guide and was open to any questions thrown at her. I"m glad we did this as I've walked past these buidings and never knew the stories and tall tales that existed before now!!

data.title: Great History of Denton
data.text: Very good value for your money to learn some interesting historical facts about Denton. Visiting the book store/Old Opera House was the best part of the tour but learning about some of the shops and old historical figures was very entertaining. Downtown Denton is cool enough but this guide and her stories will make you appreciate it even more.

data.title: Had Fun
data.text: I had a really great time. You get your 15 dollars worth and my boyfriend really enjoyed it also. If you enjoy story telling and history (and don't mind a bit of a walk) then this is the tour for you.

data.title: Very interesting
data.text: Great mix of historical fact intermingled with ghostly tales. We really enjoyed this walk around the square and appreciated the guides knowledge on the city and surrounding area. We would like to do it again, as she said the she walks different routes at different times.

data.title: Wonderful local history story telling
data.text: My husband I and took the tour and enjoyed it. If you like history, this is a great way to get a history lesson with a little humor rolled in. It sparked my interest, too bad she doesn't do other areas.

data.title: Ditch the ghosts, and it's a winner.
data.text:
I went on the Friday night tour with a couple of friends.  I was hoping for a fun activity I could do again with the foreign exchange students I work with, but I won't pay $15 again for what I got.  Here's the breakdown:

4 stars for Denton History- this part was actually my favorite!  It was really well done and I enjoyed the historical information.  I'm a lifelong Denton resident and there was a lot presented that I didn't know.  As a straight history tour, it was great!

1.5 stars for the "ghost" stories- this was disappointing.  I don't believe in ghosts and this did nothing to change my mind.  Most of the stories were people hearing footsteps and feelings from "psychics".  Yawn.  There was no information presented about who the ghosts might have been, just that there probably were ghosts.  

2 stars for the tour itself- 90 minutes and we didn't even get all the way around the square.  We spent 30 minutes inside Recycled Books, which was not worth it to me.  We didn't get to the Courthouse stories, which was disappointing.  We spent too much time at each place, and I think she could've paired down the stories she told about different venues to get us to more buildings- there are only so many stories one should tell about people hearing footsteps before it's overkill.  She said there are different stories on each tour, but I'm not paying that much to potentially get different stories.  

2 stars for the tour guide- I did not find her engaging.  She was rude to the public passing by us, and if she's been at this for four years, I'd expect her to be used to people on the square and find a less abrasive way to deal with the public.  It was a busy Friday night, and we were walking by the busiest places.  Of course people are going to listen in and bug a group like that- but she didn't have to be so short with them.  If she treated me like that, I'd never go on one of her tours.   It made me uncomfortable. 

All in all, if it were a straight history tour, I'd probably go again, but what I got was not worth what I paid.

owner_response.author: Shelly T, Owner at Ghosts of Denton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you for the feedback.  I regret that you didn't feel you got your money's worth, but am glad that you at least liked the history.  Unfortunately, since most people take a "ghost tour" expecting to hear ghost stories ... that's the content.  I apologize if you thought I was rude to the drunk man who interrupted and to the panhandler, however you might have felt differently if I had allowed them to continue to engage us.  Four years of telling stories on the square has taught me that it's not a good idea to allow that.  As for people who linger to hear stories, I let them hear one.  If they follow the group to the next location, it is not fair to paying customers to allow them to join the group.  The woman I asked to move along joined me on Saturday... and told me she had a good time.  I'm sorry that you didn't.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Loved the tour!
data.text: I booked the tour as I was intrigued by the history behind the tales of ghost and supernatural occurrences around the downtown of Denton.  Shelly was a fantastic storyteller and she kept everyone engaged in her stories.  It was a beautiful evening for a tour.  It was a small group so it was great.  You meet inside the Jupiter Coffee House which was very nice.  We got there early so we got some coffee while we waited for the tour to start.  They also served smoothies.  It nice that they offer electrical plugs near the tables to recharge our phones.  I would highly recommend the tour.  You get a good history lesson of the town.  There is also a link to the on the website if you want to learn more about the people of Denton.

data.title: This is disappointing
data.text: They are just trying to make people think that ghosts are real. It is an interesting experience I will tell you that, I just didn't like it because I knew everything was just special effects..

owner_response.author: Shelly T, Owner at Ghosts of Denton, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Hi Evan,
I'm not sure what tour you took (I don't have you listed as one of my guests), but I'm sorry you were disappointed.  There are no "special effects."  All I offer are stories.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: She is a wonderful storyteller!
data.text: This is a fun thing to do with family and friends. The stories are interesting and wonderfully told!

data.title: Interesting history of the City of Denton, Texas learned!
data.text: My wife and I really enjoyed the Ghost Tour of the city of Denton, Texas.  We both learned interesting facts about the downtown area.  Shelly Tucker is a very entertaining and great storyteller.  We would recommend this tour to everyone.

data.title: "Interesting and Entertaining Evening in Historic Texas Town!"
data.text: We were looking for a fun evening out and discovered the Ghost Tour in Denton, TX was just the thing we needed for a change in routine.  The "Ghost Lady" who is the tour guide is a wonderful storyteller and she's clearly spent lots of time researching the history of the downtown area.  Her rapport with the crowd was easily engaged and held everyone's attention throughout the two hour walk.  Since all the 'background' material is anecdotal there's always room for skeptics to criticize her stories, but she 'sold' the scary parts of every story quite convincingly and with great detail and emotion.  I thought it was a bit pricey ($15/pp) but didn't feel like it was not worth the time spent.  She is very clever with planting 'seeds' for a return visit by suggesting that a visit in a different time of the year often results in more intriguing experiences for visitors. If nothing else the tour allows you to see and learn about some fascinating history of this little Texas town that has grown up amidst lots of strange people and events that make this an interesting venture.

owner_response.author: Shelly T, Owner at Ghosts of Denton, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thanks so much for the kind words!  I enjoyed getting to take you around the town and share the stories.  I'm glad you had a good time, and of course I hope you will come again.  Just a word about the "pricey" part, because I've wrestled with the delicate balance of fair pricing.  Please note that I limit the number of participants to 30 people (which hurts me in peak season) in hopes of making it more enjoyable for the audience.  If you take a tour in Galveston, you will pay $20.  In Jefferson, you will pay $14, or in San Antonio $15 --- but they don't limit the size of the audience, so you might be mashed in with 80 other people.  I want you to have a good time, but I also want to buy groceries!  Ghost Lady has gotta eat!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Denton History
data.text: We took this tour on July 4, 2014 - unseasonably cool temperatures.  Great walking tour to learn about the history of Denton and some of the ghosts, many that continue to protect our sweet little city.  We ended the evening with ice cream from Beth Marie's and enjoyed people watching.  I look forward to taking another tour this spring!

data.title: Very interesting, great guide
data.text: We live locally and were looking for something different to do in town.  Shelly is very invested and clearly loves what she does.  It is obvious that a great deal of research has gone into the stories as well.  Fun for all ages and reasonably priced.

data.title: Great tour
data.text: We took this walking tour in October and loved it. It was two hours of local history mixed in with some great ghost stories.
